data.text: @margaretbmadden @people Yes!! I look at pics where I hid my body under baggy band t-shirts and it makes me so sad! edited fitness pics are awful.

@SharonLeavy1 @people I look at photos now and can’t believe I thought I was fat. These kind of shows are making things even worse! And those feckin’ filtered Instagram photos from ‘fitness’ bloggers! All fake arses and photoshopped thighs. Enough!

@margaretbmadden @people I was always bigger than my friends and it demolished my self confidence. I didn't go out, I wasn't outgoing, felt like the fat ugly one and in reality there was one dress size between my friends and I. I binged, gained, felt guilty, repeat. Awful waste of teenage years!

@SharonLeavy1 @people The more I think about it, the angrier I get. I STARVED myself, as a teen, because I wanted to be ‘perfect’. I was almost 40 before I realized that my health was more important than what I looked like in a pair of jeans. #nolollipopsrequired

@margaretbmadden @people That's exactly it. Whatever it says about standing job for yourself is totally voided by the fact that she had to "get hot" to do it. Why not let the big girl be accepted and proud and liked? An actual one, not a tiny one in a fat suit.

@people I can sort of see what they’re trying to do, but I do think they lost their way with it. I saw the trailer earlier today & my first reaction was definitely ‘huh, how is this okay? This will f**k up so many kids’. As it went on it did improve somewhat, but not enough. Damage done.

@SharonLeavy1 @people I’d be noticing the porn-star-lipstick- and-lollipop look 🤬 It’s a show that Young Teens will be watching. I’m all for the revenge on bullies, but by showing them that you’re a better PERSON than them - not that you’re better LOOKING than them. Really annoys me.

@margaretbmadden @people surprised at Alyssa. That show isn't aimed at adults and the only thing I'd have taken from it as a teen was an eating disorder or the notion that if I didn't eat for a summer I'd be skinny. its dangerous shite!
